newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bank SBC optimistic on 1997 outlook.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bank SBC optimistic on 1997 outlook.

text.p: Swiss Bank Corp chairman Georges Blum said he was cautiously optimistic about prospects for 1997.
SBC in a statement quoted chief executive Marcel Ospel as adding that the group anticipates net profit after tax of 1.7 billion Swiss francs ($1.2 billion) in 1997.

"Commenting on the 1996 group financial statements, chairman of the board Georges Blum assessed the prospects for the current year as cautiously optimistic," SBC said in a statement summarising speeches prepared for the annual shareholders meeting.
The statement also quoted from chief executive Marcel Ospel's speech to the meeting.
"Even if we cannot simply extrapolate the good results of the first quarter for the whole year, we still anticipate net profits after-tax of 1.7 billion Swiss francs in 1997," Ospel said.
SBC on May 9 said first quarter results were excellent, benefiting from restructuring moves launched last year and from a strong performance in securities markets in the first three months.

SBC posted a 1996 net profit before extraordinaries of 1.328 billion Swiss francs, but took a one-off charge for provisioning and restructuring that knocked the results to a net loss of 1.955 billion.
SBC last September forecast a 1997 net profit of 1.7 billion francs.
